arez.annotations

Annotation Type ArezComponent


  • @Documented
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface ArezComponent
    Annotation that marks classes to be processed by Arez annotation processor. Classes with this annotation can contain Observable properties, Computed properties, Observed methods and Action methods.

    The annotation controls the way that contained actions and observables are named (if names are enabled in the system.

    • The value returned by name() indicates the type name for instances of this object. If not specified it will default to the SimpleName of the class. i.e. The class com.biz.models.MyModel will default to a name of "MyModel".
    • The nameIncludesId() method indicates whether the names in generated components should include the id. If you expect only one instance of this component, it can be simpler to elide the id.

    The name of any elements contained within the component follows the pattern "[ArezComponent.name].[ArezComponent.id].[Element.name]". If the value of nameIncludesId() is false then the "[ArezComponent.id]." element of the name will be elided.

    The type that is annotated with @ArezComponent annotation must comply with the additional constraints:

    • Must be a class, not an interface or enum
    • Must be concrete, not abstract
    • Must not be final
    • Must not be a non-static nested class
    • Must have at least one method annotated with Action, Observed, Computed or Observable

    The annotation processor that handles this annotation will analyze all super classes and super interfaces. This includes analysis of default methods on interfaces. So it is perfectly valid to add Observable, Computed, Action, PreDispose and PostDispose annotations to default methods on implemented interfaces.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean allowConcrete
      Return true if the component type does not need to be abstract.
      boolean allowEmpty
      Return true if the component does not need to explicitly declare elements.
      Feature dagger
      Indicate whether a dagger module should be generated for enhanced component class.
      boolean deferSchedule
      Return true if an the generated component should NOT trigger scheduler at the end of the constructor.
      boolean disposeOnDeactivate
      Return true if the component should dispose itself once it is no longer "observed".
      Feature disposeTrackable
      Return enum to control whether the component should support implement DisposeTrackable.
      Feature inject
      Indicate whether an @Inject annotation should be added to constructor of the generated class.
      String name
      Return the name of the type.
      boolean nameIncludesId
      Return true if the name derived for component should include the id, false otherwise.
      Feature observable
      Return the enum to control whether the component should support being "observed" by ComponentObservable.observe(Object).
      Feature requireEquals
      Indicate whether a component requires that the Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object) methods are implemented.
      Feature requireId
      Indicates whether the component should support access of the id via Identifiable.getArezId(Object).
      Feature verify
      Indicates whether the component should implement the interface Verifiable.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        @Nonnull
public abstract String name
        Return the name of the type. The value must conform to the requirements of a java identifier.
        Returns:
        the name of the type.
        Default:
        "<default>"

      • nameIncludesId

        public abstract boolean nameIncludesId
        Return true if the name derived for component should include the id, false otherwise. If the user does not specify a value for this parameter but does specify the javax.inject.Singleton on the same type then the default value of this parameter is false, otherwise it is true.
        Returns:
        true to include the id in the component name, false otherwise.
        Default:
        true

      • allowEmpty

        public abstract boolean allowEmpty
        Return true if the component does not need to explicitly declare elements. Otherwise if no elements (i.e. Observables, Actions, Observeds etc) are defined on a component it will generate an error.
        Returns:
        true if the component does not need to explicitly declare elements, false otherwise.
        Default:
        false

      • allowConcrete

        public abstract boolean allowConcrete
        Return true if the component type does not need to be abstract. Otherwise an error will be generated if this annotation is added to a concrete type.
        Returns:
        true if the component type does not need to be abstract.
        Default:
        false

      • observable

        public abstract Feature observable
        Return the enum to control whether the component should support being "observed" by ComponentObservable.observe(Object). Feature.ENABLE will force the implementation of the ComponentObservable interface, Feature.DISABLE will result in not implementing the ComponentObservable interface and Feature.AUTODETECT will cause the component to implement the interface if the component is also annotated with the Repository annotation or if the disposeOnDeactivate() parameter is true.
        Returns:
        enum to control whether the component should support being "observed".
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • disposeTrackable

        public abstract Feature disposeTrackable
        Return enum to control whether the component should support implement DisposeTrackable. This will result in the component invoking dispose listener callbacks during dispose operation within the scope of the disposing transaction.

        Feature.ENABLE will force the implementation of the DisposeTrackable interface, Feature.DISABLE will result in not implementing the DisposeTrackable interface and Feature.AUTODETECT will cause the component to implement the interface if the component is not annotated with javax.inject.Singleton.

        Returns:
        Return enum to control whether the component should support implement DisposeTrackable.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • disposeOnDeactivate

        public abstract boolean disposeOnDeactivate
        Return true if the component should dispose itself once it is no longer "observed". By "observed" it means that the component will have ComponentObservable.observe(Object) called on it. This parameter MUST be false if observable() has the value Feature.DISABLE.
        Returns:
        true if the component should dispose itself once it is no longer "observed".
        Default:
        false

      • inject

        public abstract Feature inject
        Indicate whether an @Inject annotation should be added to constructor of the generated class. Feature.ENABLE will force the addition of an @Inject annotation, Feature.DISABLE will result in no @Inject annotation and Feature.AUTODETECT will add an @Inject if any fields or methods in the component or any parent type has an @Inject annotation OR the class has an annotation that is itself annotated with the javax.inject.Scope annotation.
        Returns:
        enum controlling present of Inject annotation on constructor.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • dagger

        public abstract Feature dagger
        Indicate whether a dagger module should be generated for enhanced component class. Feature.ENABLE will force the generation of the module, Feature.DISABLE will result in no dagger module and Feature.AUTODETECT will add a dagger module if the dagger.Module class is present on the classpath AND the class has an annotation that is itself annotated with the javax.inject.Scope annotation.
        Returns:
        enum controlling whether a dagger module should be generated for repository.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • deferSchedule

        public abstract boolean deferSchedule
        Return true if an the generated component should NOT trigger scheduler at the end of the constructor. This is useful if the component creator will trigger schedules manually at a later time. This MUST be false if there is no observed methods annotated on the component.
        Returns:
        return true if an the generated component should NOT trigger scheduler at the end of the constructor.
        Default:
        false

      • requireEquals

        public abstract Feature requireEquals
        Indicate whether a component requires that the Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object) methods are implemented. These methods MUST be implemented if the Repository annotation is present but may be implemented in other scenarios. Feature.ENABLE will force the generation of the methods, Feature.DISABLE will not generate these methods and Feature.AUTODETECT will generated these methods if the Repository annotation is present.
        Returns:
        enum controlling whether the Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object) methods are implemented.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • requireId

        public abstract Feature requireId
        Indicates whether the component should support access of the id via Identifiable.getArezId(Object). This must be supported if the Repository annotation is present but may be supported in other scenarios. This feature is present on all components if Arez.areNativeComponentsEnabled() is true, Arez.areRegistriesEnabled() is true or Arez.areNamesEnabled() is true and nameIncludesId() is true. In other scenarios it can be disabled. This is usually done to decrease code-size. Feature.ENABLE will require support, Feature.DISABLE will remove support and Feature.AUTODETECT will add support if the Repository annotation is present or a method annotated with ComponentId is present. If the Repository annotation is present or a method annotated with ComponentId is present then it is an error to set the value to Feature.DISABLE.
        Returns:
        enum controlling whether a unique if of the component can be accessed via Identifiable.getArezId(Object).
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT

      • verify

        public abstract Feature verify
        Indicates whether the component should implement the interface Verifiable. This feature is ignored unless Arez.isVerifyEnabled() is true. The Feature.AUTODETECT value will enable this feature if the component has any Reference methods or any Inverse methods.
        Returns:
        enum that indicates whether the component should implement the interface Verifiable.
        Default:
        arez.annotations.Feature.AUTODETECT
